H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H4124.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} and one of his daughters; ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8313.def: = process by which an object is consumed by fire

H7875.def: = substance produced by burning limestone or other materials containing calcium; ► mixed with water to produce whitewash

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H4124.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} and one of his daughters; ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H759.def: = building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H8643.def: = loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

H7782.def: = a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H5275.def: = a covering for the foot ◄ usually made of leather or wood ► either  open and laced around the foot or ankle with a strap, or closed around the foot like a shoe

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

34.gl: to go to > have sex with

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H6064.def: = causative action by which someone in authority forces humans to pay a certain amount in monetary value or in kind, ► usually as retribution for a certain offense

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1363.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H2634.def: = state in which humans are exceedingly powerful

H437.def: = a large-size tree found either alone or in clumps or forests; ◄ one of the varieties of |iQuercus|i*; ► functioned as landmarks, grave marks or gathering places; since its groves were considered sacred by Canaanites, ritual practices under them was always a temptation to Israelites, denounced in the texts as idolatry; ≈ their characteristics made them suitable symbols of a variety of attributes or attitudes

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H705.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H567.def: = member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H5139.def: = a person who has been singled out for a position of leadership

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5699.def: = two or four-wheeled carriage or cart, used for travel or the transport of loads; pulled by draft animals, such as {L:oxen<SDBH:שֹׁור>}, {L:donkeys<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}, or {L:horses<SDBH:סוּס>}

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H5995.def: = harvested grain, whether bundled in sheaves or not

H4498.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H7031.def: = state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H533.def: = state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
